ygData.subject: Openglad 0.95
ygData.msgSnippet: Openglad 0.95 has been released! Although the version number has only incremented by .05, there have been a whole lot of improvements. Here s a summary: 1.

Openglad 0.95 has been released! Although the version number has only
incremented by .05, there have been a whole lot of improvements. Here's a
summary:

1. Sean implemented a new way to do pixel doubling, and the graphics look
much much better (and less pixilated) now.
2. Several megs of memory leaks were fixed.
3. The game now finds files easier.
4. Its now much easier to compile and install Openglad on any unix-based
system.
5. Some fading code was donated so all features are implemented now.
6. Countless bugs were fixed. The game is now rock-solid.

0.95 was released about 20 minutes ago. Only the source was released
today, but as I said, its very easy to compile on any unix-ish OS (Linux,
FreeBSD, OpenBSD, etc...). There were some weird issues with Windows last
time I tried to compile it on that platform, so windows binaries might
take a little while. If anyone wants to help with that, they're more than
welcome to.

The source also ships with utilities for editing pixie files and packing
the .001's. I'll release those as binaries when the other binaries are
released.


That's all I can think of right now. If I remember anything else, I'll
send another email off.

Thanks to everyone who made this possible, the Open Source community, and
FSGames.


- Zardus
